footnotes.english_saheeh: [1947]- Referring to the places known for their production, i.e., Damascus and Jerusalem, respectively. It could also refer to the fig and olive trees or to the fruits themselves.

translations.english_saheeh: By the fig and the olive[1947]
translations.english_hilali_khan: By the fig, and the olive.
translations.english_rwwad: By the fig and the olive [of Jerusalem],
and by this secure city [of Makkah],

arabic_text: لَقَدۡ خَلَقۡنَا ٱلۡإِنسَٰنَ فِيٓ أَحۡسَنِ تَقۡوِيمٖ

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1948]- i.e., upright, symmetrical, and balanced in form and nature.

translations.english_saheeh: We have certainly created man in the best of stature;[1948]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, We created man in the best stature (mould).
translations.english_rwwad: Surely We have created man in the best form,

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1949]- This can refer to the depths of Hell, to decrepit old age or to immorality.

translations.english_saheeh: Then We return him to the lowest of the low,[1949]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then We reduced him to the lowest of the low.
translations.english_rwwad: then We will reduce him to the lowest of the low,

arabic_text: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ وَعَمِلُواْ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ فَلَهُمۡ أَجۡرٌ غَيۡرُ مَمۡنُونٖ
phonetic: 95.6 'Illā Al-Ladhīna 'Āmanū Wa `Amilū Aş-Şāliĥāti Falahum 'Ajrun Ghayru Mamnūnin

translations.english_saheeh: Except for those who believe and do righteous deeds, for they will have a reward uninterrupted.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Save those who believe (in Islâmic Monotheism) and do righteous deeds. Then they shall have a reward without end (Paradise).
translations.english_rwwad: except those who believe and do righteous deeds; they will have a never-ending reward.

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1950]- More literally, "What makes you lie concerning it?"

translations.english_saheeh: So what yet causes you to deny the Recompense?[1950]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then what (or who) causes you (O disbelievers) to deny the Recompense (i.e. the Day of Resurrection)?
translations.english_rwwad: Then, what makes you deny the Judgment Day?

translations.english_saheeh: Is not Allāh the most just of judges?
translations.english_hilali_khan: Is not Allâh the Best of judges?
translations.english_rwwad: Is not Allah the Most Just of all judges?
